hero.title: MCP Agents Hub
hero.subtitle: The open-source ecosystem for building, discovering, and deploying Model Context Protocol servers and clients for enterprise environments.

whatIsMcp.title: What is the Model Context Protocol?
whatIsMcp.paragraph1: The Model Context Protocol (MCP) is an open standard that enables developers to build secure, two-way connections between their data sources and AI-powered tools. The architecture is straightforward: developers can either expose their data through MCP servers or build AI applications (MCP clients) that connect to these servers.
whatIsMcp.paragraph2: With MCP, AI systems can maintain context as they move between different tools and datasets, replacing today's fragmented integrations with a more sustainable architecture. Instead of building custom connectors for each data source or AI model, developers can now build against a standard protocol.

specification.title: MCP Specification
specification.description: The open standard protocol definition that enables interoperability between servers and clients

servers.title: MCP Servers
servers.description: Custom-built connectors that expose data sources, tools, and APIs to AI applications

clients.title: MCP Clients
clients.description: AI-powered applications that connect to MCP servers to access contextual data and functionality

whyMarketplace.title: Why MCP Marketplace?
whyMarketplace.description: As the MCP ecosystem expands, organizations need a central hub to manage, discover, and share MCP resources. This marketplace serves as that hub, enabling enterprises to:

benefits.discover: Discover pre-built MCP servers for common enterprise systems
benefits.share: Share custom MCP servers developed within their organization
benefits.learn: Learn best practices for building effective MCP connectors
benefits.deploy: Deploy the entire marketplace on-premise for security and governance

features.title: Your Enterprise MCP Hub
features.description: This open-source marketplace allows organizations to deploy their own on-premise MCP hub, creating a central repository for discovering, sharing, and managing MCP servers and clients within their enterprise environment.

serverBuilding.title: Server Building
serverBuilding.description: Learn to create custom MCP servers that connect enterprise data sources to AI models securely and efficiently. Our marketplace provides templates, examples, and best practices to accelerate server development.

clientDevelopment.title: Client Development
clientDevelopment.description: Build AI applications that leverage the MCP protocol to access contextual data across your organization. Connect your apps to any MCP server with standardized interfaces.

toolDiscovery.title: Tool Discovery
toolDiscovery.description: Find pre-built MCP servers for popular enterprise systems like Google Drive, Slack, GitHub, Git, Postgres, Puppeteer and more. Deploy them instantly in your organization.

showcase.title: Powering Enterprise AI Integration
showcase.description: Early adopters have already integrated MCP into their systems, while development tools companies are working with MCP to enhance their platforms—enabling AI agents to better retrieve relevant information and produce more functional results with fewer attempts.

quote.text: "Open technologies like the Model Context Protocol are the bridges that connect AI to real-world applications, ensuring innovation is accessible, transparent, and rooted in collaboration. We are excited to partner on a protocol and use it to build agentic systems, which remove the burden of the mechanical so people can focus on the creative."
quote.author: Dhanji R. Prasanna

enterprise.title: Enterprise-Ready Deployment
enterprise.description: Deploy this marketplace in your own on-premise environment to create a secure, internal hub for MCP tools and resources. Enable your organization's developers to:

benefits.share: Share internally developed MCP servers across teams
benefits.discover: Discover and deploy pre-built connectors for enterprise systems
benefits.maintain: Maintain governance and security requirements for AI integrations
benefits.foster: Foster collaboration between data owners and AI application developers

onPremise.title: On-Premise Solution
onPremise.description: Fully deployable within your existing infrastructure

community.title: An Open Community
community.description: We're committed to building MCP as a collaborative, open-source project and ecosystem. Whether you're an AI tool developer, an enterprise looking to leverage existing data, or an early adopter exploring the frontier, we invite you to build the future of context-aware AI together.

hero.title: Getting Started with MCP
hero.subtitle: Start building and testing MCP connectors today with our comprehensive documentation and tools.

availability.title: Availability
availability.paragraph1: The Model Context Protocol (MCP) is designed to be universally compatible with various AI models and client applications, not just limited to a single provider.
availability.paragraph2: Multiple client applications support connecting to MCP servers, allowing you to enhance AI capabilities with access to your custom data, tools, and systems. You can use MCP to connect your internal systems and datasets to any compatible AI client.
availability.paragraph3: Developers can build and test MCP servers locally, and deploy production MCP servers that can serve entire organizations. The open protocol enables integration with various AI platforms and applications.

startUsing.title: Start Using
startUsing.subtitle: For end users and AI application users: If you're looking to enhance your AI experience with custom tools and data sources, explore these MCP-compatible clients.

claudeDesktop.title: Claude Desktop
claudeDesktop.description: Connect to MCP servers directly from your Claude Desktop app. Supports both local and remote MCP servers.

vsCodeExtension.title: VS Code Extension
vsCodeExtension.description: Connect directly to MCP servers from your VS Code environment for enhanced coding assistance.

jetbrainsPlugin.title: JetBrains IDE Plugin
jetbrainsPlugin.description: Use MCP servers within JetBrains IDEs like IntelliJ, PyCharm, and others to enhance your development experience.

startBuilding.title: Start Building
startBuilding.subtitle: For developers: Choose the development path that matches your goals - build MCP servers to extend AI capabilities or integrate MCP into your client applications.

customServers.title: Build Custom Servers
customServers.description: Create servers that connect your data sources, tools, and APIs to MCP-compatible AI models.

serverSDK.title: Server SDK
serverSDK.description: Use our SDK to implement the MCP specification and build servers that connect to various client applications.

serverTemplates.title: Server Templates
serverTemplates.description: Start with pre-built templates for common use cases like document retrieval, database connectivity, and tool use.

clientSDK.title: Client SDK
clientSDK.description: Implement MCP in your AI applications to enable connectivity with a wide range of MCP servers and tools.

integrationGuide.title: Integration Guide
integrationGuide.description: Learn how to integrate MCP connectivity into your AI-powered applications, platforms, and interfaces.

contribute.title: Contribute
contribute.description: Join our open-source community and contribute to improving MCP clients and implementations.

cta.title: Ready to Get Started?
cta.subtitle: Join our growing community of developers building the future of AI integration with MCP.
